title: Ticket #6253: Add SSL (https) support to curl_plugin
description: We should add SSL (https) support to the curl_plugin transfer mechanism. Modern websites are increasingly using https by default and we are currently not able to use this protocol.
remarks:
2017-Sep-21 13:53:35 by coatsworth:
This is fixed. The main update was changing the following line, which initializes Win32 support: 

curl_global_init( CURL_GLOBAL_WIN32 );

... to the following, which initializes both SSL + Win32 support: 

curl_global_init( CURL_GLOBAL_DEFAULT );

In theory, we could have achieved this by initializing SSL and Win32 on separate lines, ie: 

curl_global_init( CURL_GLOBAL_WIN32 );
curl_global_init( CURL_GLOBAL_SSL );

However for some mysterious reason, this causes libcurl to segfault on https:// transfers. Using CURL_GLOBAL_DEFAULT to initialize them seems to work correctly.

2017-Oct-23 08:50:52 by tim:
Code Review: Looks good. Any reason you chose CURL_GLOBAL_DEFAULT? Everywhere else in HTCondor we use CURL_GLOBAL_ALL. But, they are equivalent.

2017-Oct-25 10:27:38 by tim:
Doc Review: OK

2017-Oct-25 14:08:47 by coatsworth:
No particular reason, CURL_GLOBAL_DEFAULT was the first thing I tried that worked correctly. Never tried CURL_GLOBAL_ALL. Does it matter?

2017-Oct-25 16:26:45 by tim:
The constants are equivalent, so as far as executing the code, it is identical. Reading the code, they look different. So, it's more of a style thing. I don't feel strongly enough about it to ask for a change.
